1.text: For this cause I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles,

2.text: If ye have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me to you-ward:

3.text: How that by revelation he made known unto me the mystery; (as I wrote afore in few words,

4.text: Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

5.text: Which in other ages was not made known unto the sons of men, as it is now revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit;

6.text: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, and of the same body, and partakers of his promise in Christ by the gospel:

7.text: Whereof I was made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God given unto me by the effectual working of his power.

8.text: Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, is this grace given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;

9.text: And to make all [men] see what [is] the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the world hath been hid in God, who created all things by Jesus Christ:

10.text: To the intent that now unto the principalities and powers in heavenly [places] might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God,

11.text: According to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:

12.text: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.

13.text: Wherefore I desire that ye faint not at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.

14.text: For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

15.text: Of whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named,

16.text: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;

17.text: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,

18.text: May be able to comprehend with all saints what [is] the breadth, and length, and depth, and height;

19.text: And to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge, that ye might be filled with all the fulness of God.

20.text: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,

21.text: Unto him [be] glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.
